dt: {bc}governed by or conforming to the {d_link|dictates|dictate:2} of {d_link|conscience|conscience} {bc}{sx|scrupulous||}

pt: {sc}upright{/sc} {sc}honest{/sc} {sc}just{/sc} {sc}conscientious{/sc} {sc}scrupulous{/sc} {sc}honorable{/sc} mean having or showing a strict regard for what is morally right. {sc}upright{/sc} implies a strict adherence to moral principles.
{sc}honest{/sc} stresses adherence to such virtues as truthfulness, candor, or fairness.

pt.t: known for being {it}honest{/it} in business dealings

pt: {sc}just{/sc} stresses conscious choice and regular practice of what is right or equitable.
{sc}conscientious{/sc} and {sc}scrupulous{/sc} imply an active moral sense governing all one's actions and painstaking efforts to follow one's conscience.

pt.t: {it}conscientious{/it} in the completion of her assignments
{it}scrupulous{/it} in carrying out the terms of the will

pt: {sc}honorable{/sc} suggests a firm holding to codes of right behavior and the guidance of a high sense of honor and duty.

quotes.t: He was shifty about money matters, not {qword}conscientious{/qword} about returning advances, fulfilling contracts, reading manuscripts.
He was a good friend to his comrades, a {qword}conscientious{/qword} leader mindful of his men's needs; an upright family man with strong, bright, proud children …

Because Puckett was a {qword}conscientious{/qword} lieutenant … his men did not have to stint on their fire. He had made sure that every man was carrying a basic load of ammunition and then some to spare …

shortdef: governed by or conforming to the dictates of conscience : scrupulous

dt: {bc}objection on moral or religious grounds (as to service in the armed forces or to bearing arms)

shortdef: objection on moral or religious grounds (as to service in the armed forces or to bearing arms)

dt: {bc}a person who refuses to serve in the armed forces or bear arms on moral or religious grounds

shortdef: a person who refuses to serve in the armed forces or bear arms on moral or religious grounds
